title: rustdoc: Links to types in other crates broken when docs inlined via re-export from another crate
body:
Let's say you have crates A, B, and C, where:

1. Crate A has a struct named `AType`.
2. Crate B depends on crate A, and has a struct named `BType` that has docs that link to type `AType` in crate A.
3. Crate C depends on crate B, and has a struct named `CType` that re-exports `B::BType` with `#[doc(inline)]`.

In the docs for crate C, the link to `AType` in the inlined documentation for `BType` is broken.

For a more concrete example, the crate [`aws-sdk-s3`](https://crates.io/crates/aws-sdk-s3) re-exports `aws_smithy_http::byte_stream::Bytestream`, which has a link to `futures_core::Stream` in its docs. This results in the inlined docs for `Bytestream` having a broken link to `Stream`, which can be observed [in these docs](https://docs.rs/aws-sdk-s3/0.7.0/aws_sdk_s3/types/struct.ByteStream.html) (where it says "Via impl Stream").

### Meta

Observed this with stable rustdoc 1.56.1 and rustdoc 1.61.0-nightly (4b043faba 2022-02-24).
